fusetools.cloud_tools.Firebase¶

class fusetools.cloud_tools.Firebase[source]¶

Bases: object

Functions for interacting with Firebase infrastructure, including: Firestore, Storage

Methods

delete_bucket_object

Deletes a bucket object.

file_to_bucket

Sends a local file to a storage bucket.

initapp

Initializes an application instance for your Firebase project.

list_bucket_objects

Lists objects in a bucket.

load_delete_firestore

Executes an Insert, Update or Delete operation on a Firestore database object.
classmethod delete_bucket_object(blob_name, bucket_name=False)[source]¶

Deletes a bucket object.

Parameters

  • blob_name – Name of bucket object.

  • bucket_name – Name of bucket.

Returns

Confirmation of bucket object that was deleted.

classmethod file_to_bucket(blob_name, file_path, content_type=None, bucket_name=False, metadata_d=False)[source]¶

Sends a local file to a storage bucket.

Parameters

  • blob_name – Name for file to have after being loaded to storage bucket.

  • file_path – Filepath of file to load.

  • content_type – Type of file, such as ‘image/png’.

  • bucket_name – Name of bucket to send file to.

  • metadata_d – Metadata dictionary to attach to a file (optional).

Returns

classmethod initapp(db_url, storage_url, token_path)[source]¶

Initializes an application instance for your Firebase project.

Parameters

  • db_url – Firestore instance URL for your project.

  • storage_url – Storage instance URL for your project.

  • token_path – Local path of your Firebase credentials token.

Returns

Authenticated application instance for your Firebase project.

classmethod list_bucket_objects(bucket_name=False)[source]¶

Lists objects in a bucket.

Parameters

bucket_name – Name of bucket.

Returns

List of bucket objects.

classmethod load_delete_firestore(obj_types, obj_names, method, d=False, constraint_key=False, constraint_val=False, delete_object_type=False, upsert_doc_name=False, document_delete_batch_size=False)[source]¶

Executes an Insert, Update or Delete operation on a Firestore database object.

Parameters

  • parent_object_type – Type of object containing operation target.

  • parent_collection_name – Name of parent collection.

  • method – Operation type: “insert”, “update”, “delete”.

  • d – Data object (required for insert, update)

  • constraint_key – Name of field to constraint updates and deletes to.

  • constraint_val – Value of field to constraint updates and deletes to.

  • parent_sub_collection_name – Name of parent sub collection if object lives inside sub collection.

  • parent_document_name – Name of parent document if object lives inside a document (sub collection).

  • upsert – Specifies whether to insert target data if no data is found to update.

  • document_delete_batch_size – Limit of documents to delete per function call to avoid Memory errors.

Returns

JSON response for API call.
